column1: Dayr Hafir (Arabic: دَيْر حَافِر‎ / ALA-LC: Dayr Ḥāfir) is a Syrian city in the Aleppo Governorate
column2: 50 kilometres (31 miles) east of Aleppo on the Aleppo-Raqqa highway
column3: 15 kilometres (9.3 miles) to the north of Sabkhat al-Jabbul. It is the regional centre of Dayr Hafir District. In the 2004 official census
column4: the town of Dayr Hafir had a population of 18
column5: 948. The town is home to an archeological site dating back to the 9th millennium BC.

column1: Dayr Hafir is still a rural community in its majority.

column3: the government was reported to be in control of this town that is close to a military airport (Kweiris). The city came under the control of the Islamic State of Iraq and the Levant in 2014
column4: before being retaken by Syrian Government forces during the Dayr Hafir offensive.
